unnormalised: **Auto Buzz: New Wheels Hit the Indian Roads!**
normalised: **Auto Buzz: New Wheels Hit the Indian Roads!**

unnormalised: Namaste auto enthusiasts! The Indian automotive scene is heating up faster than a Delhi summer! We've seen a flurry of vehicle launches this week, from budget-friendly hatchbacks to luxurious SUVs that could practically drive themselves to Tirupati.
normalised: Namaste auto enthusiasts! The Indian automotive scene is heating up faster than a Delhi summer! We've seen a flurry of vehicle launches this week, from budget-friendly hatchbacks to luxurious S U Vs that could practically drive themselves to Tirupati.

unnormalised: First up, Mahindra unveiled its Bolero Neo+ in a jazzy new avatar. Sources say it's packing more power and space – perfect for those family road trips to Rajasthan.
normalised: First up, Mahindra unveiled its Bolero Neo plus in a jazzy new avatar. Sources say it's packing more power and space – perfect for those family road trips to Rajasthan.

unnormalised: Then, Maruti Suzuki finally dropped the curtain on the much-awaited Jimny 5-door. This baby promises to be a capable off-roader, tackling those tricky Himalayan roads with ease. Prices are expected to start around Rs. 12 Lakh.
normalised: Then, Maruti Suzuki finally dropped the curtain on the much-awaited Jimny five door. This baby promises to be a capable off roader, tackling those tricky Himalayan roads with ease. Prices are expected to start around rupee twelve lakh.

unnormalised: Tata Motors isn't sleeping either. They showcased a concept electric SUV with a massive touchscreen and a panoramic sunroof that’s bigger than my living room (well, almost - it's like 200 sq ft). Dr. Sharma from ARAI was pretty impressed!
normalised: Tata Motors isn't sleeping either. They showcased a concept electric S U V with a massive touchscreen and a panoramic sunroof that’s bigger than my living room (well, almost - it's like two hundred square feet). Dr. Sharma from A R A I was pretty impressed!

unnormalised: Rumours are also swirling about Hyundai launching a competitor to the Kia Seltos. The competition is intense, folks! Keep your eyes peeled for more updates. We’ll be bringing you the deets on these beauties, including fuel efficiency (km/l) and performance reviews. Happy driving!
normalised: Rumours are also swirling about Hyundai launching a competitor to the Kia Seltos. The competition is intense, folks! Keep your eyes peeled for more updates. We’ll be bringing you the deets on these beauties, including fuel efficiency (kilometer per liter) and performance reviews. Happy driving!
